Merged other soultion #7174

Major changes:

1) Added GridClientClusterStateRequestV2.
2) Deprecated GridClientClusterStateRequest.
3) Added flag force for REST in GridRestClusterStateRequest
4) Added flag force CLI in DeactivateCommand, ClusterStateChangeCommand.
5) Added IgniteFeatures# FORCED_CHANGE_OF_CLUSTER_STATE.
6) Added checking of deactivation safety: GridClusterStateProcessor# isDeactivationSafe()

Behaviour cnages:
- Durations of service method can be measured and stored into histogram.
- If service proxy requested, it is now proxy fol local service instead of direct link.
- ServiceConfiguration can now disable/enable metrics for service.
- Service metrics are stored in registey "Services" (`IgniteServiceProcessor.SERVICE_METRIC_REGISTRY`) by service name.

Significant code changes:
- `IgniteServices.serviceProxy(*)` now returns proxy even for locally deployed service.
- Deprecated `IgniteServices.service()` and `IgniteServices.services()`.
- Introduced `ServiceConfiguration.isStatisticsEnabled`.
- Introduced in `IgniteServices`: `clusterSingletonConfiguration()`, `nodeSingletonConfiguration()`, `keyAffinitySingletonConfiguration()` and `multipleConfiguration()`.

@agura  thank you for the review, @l4ndsc4pe  thank you for contribution.

Closing PR since commit https://github.com/apache/ignite/commit/27ed4240dca9d5d89a1bca850a0306ef3a12fa61 is merged

1.	Removed `GridClientClusterState#active()`

2.	Removed `GridClientClusterState#active(boolean active)`

9.      Removed, combined with ##8
`IGridClusterStateProcessor#changeGlobalState0(
        ClusterState state,
        BaselineTopology blt,
        boolean forceChangeBaselineTopology,
        boolean isAutoAdjust
    )`

Unless it is not infected itself.
It doesn't matter. It will die also.

Hello @nizhikov ,

Please don't get me wrong, but...
What is the reason to include all intermediate commit messages into the final one? https://github.com/apache/ignite/commit/4921fcf1fecbd8a1ab02099e09cc2adb0b3ff88a
Moreover, it contains the following tickets: IGNITE-12597, IGNITE-12646, and IGNITE-12703 that not related to the issue at all. It looks like it was done by accident.

> Moreover, it contains the following tickets: IGNITE-12597, IGNITE-12646, and IGNITE-12703 that not related to the issue at all. It looks like it was done by accident.

Hi, @sk0x50 

This merge doesn't contain mentioned issues IGNITE-12597, IGNITE-12646, and IGNITE-12703 at all. That was just wrong comments in my branch.

Hello @Vladsz83 ,

> This merge doesn't contain mentioned issues IGNITE-12597, IGNITE-12646, and IGNITE-12703 at all. That was just wrong comments in my branch.

Yes, I know that, and you are right. 
Perhaps, my message was not quite correct. I just wanted to say that it contains incorrect commit messages that can lead to a misunderstanding. That's all.

Thanks,
Slava.

Hello @sk0x50 

First of all, this is my fault, but the reason for the fault is GitHub bug.
I wrote a good commit message before the merge.

But after pushing the "merge" button I've got "We can't merge your PR" error message and "Try again" button. After pushing "Try again" we got what we got - merge with the default commit message.

Sorry, for that.

Hello @nizhikov,

Ok, got it! Thank you for the clarification.

Thanks,
S.

Already merged manually.

> @anton-vinogradov , Hi.
> 
> Can the new metric be placed at PME registry wihtout creating a new registry?
> 
> i.e. `pme.ClusterRebalanced` instead of `rebalance.ClusterRebalanced`
`GridPartitionedSingleGetFuture` now truely follows its flag `forcePrimary` and optimistic serializable transaction always sets `forcePrimary`.
Optimistic serializable transaction enforces checking of backup version for not-sync cache updates.
Better solution provided: https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/7575.
Metrics naming makes sense.
May I know if there is any progress with this integration?

> Also, I suppose, that we should leave to user the final conclusion to instrument methods of
> his or her service or not. I would suggest to add a bit of API for users, 

Ok, many people propose to give user the decision to enable/disable service metrics. Makes sense. My + is for Andrey Guras suggestion ( http://apache-ignite-developers.2346864.n4.nabble.com/Reference-of-local-service-tp46071p46307.html ) :
we should provide a way for configuring service metrics (in
sense of enabled/disabled) during service deploy. It's easy for cases
where deploy() methods have ServiceConfiguration as parameter.

The reasons:
-	It is quite obvious. Good place without any other condition.
-	CacheConfiguration has same property. Analogous approach simplifies product for user.
-	Can work with some global "service_metrics_enabled" or targeted "@MetricsEnabled", "@MetricsDisabled"

So, Ive introduced `ServiceConfiguration.isStatisticsEnabled`.
Migrated to better solution: https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/7622.

> Hi! I just reviewed you patch.
> Generally looks good to me.

@ivandasch , thank you for reviewing.
Superceded by #7665

Travisfile can be tweaked a bit.

- `sudo` key is deprecated and ignored. It is recomended to remove it. See https://blog.travis-ci.com/2018-11-19-required-linux-infrastructure-migration
- `language` is missing, so default `ruby` is used. You should add `language: java`
- `dist` defaults to `xenial`.  Better add `dist: xenial` explicitly. Default dist can lead to unexpected results, once travis-ci upgrades to next release (There are still many failing builds across github after travis updated default image from trusty to xenial in 2019)

Edit: According discussion ( http://apache-ignite-developers.2346864.n4.nabble.com/DISCUSSION-Pull-request-checks-on-GitHub-td46945.html ) there is intention to run oraclejdk8 in matrix. Just a note, that oraclejdk8 is no longer supported on `xenial`, so maybe `trusty` is better choice for `dist` tag
@bedlaj Thank you for your comments. I've fixed all of them.

> 
> Hello!
> ~You wrongly merged the branch upstream/ignite-2.8.1 to your PR branch. You have to hard reset your branch to the change [c8754ae](https://github.com/apache/ignite/commit/c8754ae03a58c14efcce07703015a41ea718c8ad), then merge upstream/master, cherry-pick the change [a11240a](https://github.com/apache/ignite/commit/a11240a69353dd7b35ec884b29c4168a9a718713), and finally, push your updated PR branch with --force-with-lease option.~
> I'm sorry, that's would be right if your PR was made to master branch, not to ignite-2.8.1.
> You have to make the new PR to master branch, based on newest upstream/master.

Does that mean this PR will be released on next minor release (2.9+), at the soonest?

> > Hello!
> > ~You wrongly merged the branch upstream/ignite-2.8.1 to your PR branch. You have to hard reset your branch to the change [c8754ae](https://github.com/apache/ignite/commit/c8754ae03a58c14efcce07703015a41ea718c8ad), then merge upstream/master, cherry-pick the change [a11240a](https://github.com/apache/ignite/commit/a11240a69353dd7b35ec884b29c4168a9a718713), and finally, push your updated PR branch with --force-with-lease option.~
> > I'm sorry, that's would be right if your PR was made to master branch, not to ignite-2.8.1.
> > You have to make the new PR to master branch, based on newest upstream/master.
> 
> Does that mean this PR will be released on next minor release (2.9+), at the soonest?

No, this is just the workflow. So far this change is planned to be released in scope of 2.8.1, but it must be cherry-picked to that branch from master branch by release manager of 2.8.1, not directly by committer.

Some tests at master branch can fail occasionally, you should exclude the influence of your changes by several re-runs of failed tests, the most of them should pass without failures. In case when you get some repeatedly failed tests, i.e. blockers count won't zeroed after several runs (3-5), you'll have to research those tests for affecting by your changes.

@agoncharuk 

These JIRA issues I'm planning to complete after the initial PR will be merged (probably not all of them, depends on the user-list activity):

- support snapshot creation from a client node
- add starting snapshot via control.sh
- add system snapshot view with all available snapshots on the cluster
- write snapshot meta-file on each node with additional snapshot info (baseline, caches, partitions missed during snapshot operation)
- support encryption caches for a snapshot
- remove `reject cache group stop` requirement for a snapshot operation

@SurkovAleksandr 
I'm using Ignite spring data 2.20 (Ignite version 2.8) with Spring Data 2.2.4 and I'm not able to save a simple entity to Ignite (Configured as RT/WB Cache with PGSql) . 

Please follow the detailed code snippets [here](https://gist.github.com/protyay-gintaa/9070060d5ff9a7120998c83913ace197) .

The exception says **No property found save for entity <entity_name>**

Please guide as this is a blocking issue.

Are this PR is not going to be merged? I want to use it in typescript because it provides a typing that vanilla js doesn't have
Looking for someone from the community to check the PR: http://apache-ignite-developers.2346864.n4.nabble.com/TypeScript-Review-for-Node-JS-is-needed-td47254.html
Ivan, thanks for the catch. Please go ahead and merge the changes.

In addition: please add some more tests to show improved guaranties.
For example [from here](https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/7213/files#diff-4f7cd01f46644072988d63539e6e794eR89) but without "timeout API".

testServiceTopologyInitialized and testServiceTopologyInitializationDelayed do exactly what you proposed.

Current test cases:

The service which deployment fails on all nodes invokes on the remote node before/after full message received.

The service which deployment proceeded smoothly on all nodes invokes on the remote node before/after full message received.

Invokes a statically configured service on the local node after it starts.

Are there any missing cases?
Let's add a test that asserts a desirable log format.
